intro: Discolobium leptophyllum var. junceum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved discolobium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, often pale or greenish flowers that bloom in spring, and its foliage is generally narrow and leathery. This variant is distinguished by its more elongated leaves compared to other forms of Discolobium.
